caption.paragraph:
Figures 195-197.
Gasteruption oshimense
Watanabe, large female, Shaanxi 195 habitus lateral 196 pronotum ventral 197 head and pronotum lateral.

subSubSection.paragraph: China (Gansu, Guizhou, Henan, Hunan, Jilin, Shaanxi), Japan. New for Gansu.

One of the most common species in China; large specimens tend to have the head less narrowed, less shiny and more sculptured in dorsal view (Figs 204 and 207 ). The length of the white or ivory apical part of the ovipositor sheath is highly variable in this species; two females from Shangluo have it up to 3.3 x as long as the hind basitarsus. The propleuron of
G. oshimense
is rather robust and 0.8-1.0 x as long as mesoscutum in front of tegula.
